page.title: 14OLD BARROW
page.content: {Holy Trinity Church}is at the very centre of the village and parts of it date back to the 14th century. The oldest building in{Barrow}is over 650 years old. It is called the Bishop Beveridge House after the most famous Barrovian who was born there. It used to be the vicarage and is thought to have a passage leading to the church but no one has found it. The house is made of local materials such as Mountsorrel granite, Swithland slates, red clay brick, oak timbers, pebbles, reeds and Barrow limestone. A few red brick knitters' cottages are on the same street which used to be called Industry Street. At the top of this street is a round house built in 1827 as the{village lock up.}Next to this is the{forge.}The tools are left just as the blacksmith left them many years ago.{C.SPEIGHT R.HARDY F.KING K.BOND }
